snippet.title: Cohen's Towers for the Atari 8-bit family
snippet.description:
Came also out for:

Commodore 64


Game description:

Allen, the boss' nephew, is starting as a trainee in his uncle's office.

You have to help him by collecting all packages and put them in the letterboxes.

You can have a quickie with the secretary for bonus points, but you also have to watch out for falling flowerpots, the boss' cousin-in-law, who steals packages, the boss' dog, who will run back and forth and the boss himself, whose appearence means that time is running out.


What I think:

Okay game. It is frustrating due to fact that you can easily fall through platforms, even then when you should've logically landed on them. Also the jumping is kinda stiff and sometimes Allen jumps even if you press nothing!
There are also way too many packages to deliver, which makes the game tiresome after a time.

Nonetheless, it is addictive too.
